title: Trump announces more than $200bn of deals between US and UAE
snippets:
Pledge to strengthen ties with Gulf state includes a $14.5bn agreement with Boeing, GE Aerospace and Etihad Airways

Donald Trump has announced deals totaling more than $200bn between the United States and the United Arab Emirates, including a $14.5bn commitment among Boeing, GE Aerospace and Etihad Airways, as he pledged to strengthen ties between the US and the Gulf state during a multiday trip to the Middle East.

The White House said on Thursday that Boeing and GE had received a commitment from Etihad Airways to invest $14.5bn to buy 28 US-made Boeing 787 and 777X aircraft powered by GE engines.

Continue reading...
titles: Trump announces more than $200bn of deals between US and UAE
summary: Donald Trump has announced over $200bn in deals between the US and the United Arab Emirates, aimed at strengthening bilateral ties. This includes a significant $14.5bn investment by Etihad Airways to purchase 28 Boeing aircraft, specifically the 787 and 777X models, powered by GE Aerospace engines. This agreement was confirmed during Trump's multi-day visit to the Middle East, highlighting a commitment to enhance US-Gulf state relations.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the strengthening of US-UAE bilateral ties, including specific details about the deals made. It could be more constructive if it provided more context about the implications of these deals for the broader US-Middle East relations.

title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Sheds Citi Stake, Trims Other Big Bank Holdings
snippets:
Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A, BRK.B) sold its shares of Citigroup (C) during the first quarter, while trimming its stakes in Bank of America (BAC) and Capital One (COF).

Berkshire shed its more than 14.6 million shares of Citigroup in the first three months of the year, a 13-F filing revealed Thursday. The form, which offers a snapshot of Berkshire's portfolio at the end of the quarter, does not capture any changes the company would have made since the end of March.

The conglomerate also trimmed its long-term holding in Bank of America by 48.6 million shares. It reduced its stake in Capital One by 300,000 shares, and shed all its shares in Brazilian fintech firm Nu Holdings (NU). Berkshire shrank its Liberty Media Series C Formula One (FWONK) stake, and sold shares of Charter Communications (CHTR), DaVita (DVA), and T-Mobile (TMUS) too.

Meanwhile, Buffett's firm more than doubled its position in alcoholic beverage maker Constellation Brands (STZ) to just over 12 million shares. Shares of the Modelo parent climbed close to 3% in after-hours trading.

Berkshire also added nearly 240,000 shares of Domino's Pizza (DPZ) and over 112,000 shares of electronics firm Heico (HEI). It expanded positions in VeriSign (VRSN), Sirius XM (SIRI), Pool Corp. (POOL), and Occidental Petroleum (OXY) as well.

After trimming its stake in Apple (AAPL) last year, Berkshire did not make any changes to its position in the iPhone maker during the period.

Shares of Berkshire have taken a hit in the wake of Buffett's announcement earlier this month that he plans to step down as CEO, with vice chair Greg Abel set to take the helm at year-end. Still, they’ve outperformed the broader market, with shares up about 12% since the start of the year, while the S&P 500 added just 0.6%.
titles: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Sheds Citi Stake, Trims Other Big Bank Holdings
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sold its Citigroup shares and reduced stakes in Bank of America and Capital One in the first quarter of 2023, as revealed by a 13-F filing. The company also sold its shares in several other firms, including Brazilian fintech Nu Holdings. Meanwhile, Berkshire more than doubled its investment in Constellation Brands and increased its positions in Domino's Pizza, Heico, among others. Despite Buffett announcing his plan to step down as CEO by year-end, Berkshire Hathaway's shares have risen approximately 12% in 2025, outperforming the S&P 500's 0.6% increase.
constructiveness_reason: The story provides actionable insights into the investment strategies of a prominent figure in the financial world. It offers a deeper understanding of the shifts in Berkshire Hathaway's portfolio and could inform readers' own investment decisions. It also highlights the company's progress, despite the impending departure of its CEO.

title: Caltech’s Smart Bandage Detects Infection Days in Advance
snippets: Caltech’s iCares bandage samples fluid and tracks wound biomarkers to detect infection early and predict healing outcomes. Caltech professor of medical engineering Wei Gao and his team are developing a next-generation smart bandage—a “lab on skin”—that could help patients and caregivers monitor chronic wounds, deliver treatment, and accelerate healing. Designed for cuts, incisions, scrapes, and [...]
titles: Caltech’s Smart Bandage Detects Infection Days in Advance
summary: Caltech has developed a smart bandage, named iCares, which can detect infections in wounds days before they become apparent. This innovative "lab on skin" technology, created by Professor Wei Gao and his team, samples fluid and tracks biomarkers to predict healing outcomes and potentially speed up the healing process. The iCares bandage is designed for use on various types of wounds, including cuts and scrapes, aiming to assist patients and caregivers in monitoring and treating chronic wounds effectively.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it reports on an innovative solution to a medical problem. It provides readers with actionable insights and deeper understanding about how the technology works and its potential benefits. It also highlights progress in the field of medical technology.

title: Scientists Discover Temperature-Controlled Switch That Powers Fertility
snippets: A mouse study may pave the way for new approaches to contraception and infertility treatment. Sperm are surprisingly picky when it comes to temperature. In mammals, including humans, they perform best in environments that are a few degrees cooler than normal body temperature. This raises an intriguing question: how do these heat-sensitive cells manage to [...]
titles: Scientists Discover Temperature-Controlled Switch That Powers Fertility
summary: Scientists have discovered a temperature-controlled switch in sperm that may lead to new contraception and infertility treatments. This switch allows sperm to perform optimally in environments slightly cooler than the body's normal temperature. The finding, based on a mouse study, highlights the importance of temperature in mammalian fertility.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about a scientific discovery that could potentially lead to new treatments for contraception and infertility. It increases awareness about the role of temperature in mammalian fertility. However, it doesn't provide specific actionable insights for readers, hence the score is slightly less than 1.0.

title: This Popular Anti-Aging Supplement Might Be a Waste of Money
snippets: Despite an 85% reduction in NAD+ levels, mice maintained normal muscle health and function, according to new research from the Treebak Group. In the Netflix documentary Don’t [...]
titles: This Popular Anti-Aging Supplement Might Be a Waste of Money
summary: New research by the Treebak Group reveals that despite an 85% reduction in NAD+ levels, mice retained normal muscle health and function. This challenges claims by NAD+ supplement companies about their anti-aging benefits, especially considering natural aging only leads to a 30% decline in NAD levels.
